  "article_text": [
    "in this thesis , we consider the relationship between a ring @xmath0 and @xmath9 , the @xmath8 matrix ring over @xmath0 .",
    "in particular , we investigate necessary and sufficient conditions placed on @xmath0 so that @xmath9 is a baer - ring .",
    "a ring is a _ baer - ring _ if every right ( or left ) annihilator ideal is generated by an idempotent . in determining these conditions",
    ", we make use of the existence of a morita - equivalence between @xmath0 and @xmath9 ( ) , as well as the fact that @xmath9 is isomorphic to the endomorphism ring of any free right @xmath0-module with basis @xmath10 ( ) . here , two rings are _ morita - equivalent _ if their module categories are equivalent , and the _ endomorphism ring _ @xmath11 of a right @xmath0-module @xmath1 is the set of all @xmath0-homomorphisms @xmath12 , which is a ring under pointwise addition and composition of functions",
    ".    the concepts of torsion - freeness and non - singularity of modules will also come into play .",
    "in particular , we consider rings for which the classes of torsion - free and non - singular right @xmath7-modules coincide for every ring @xmath7 morita - equivalent to @xmath0 .",
    "albrecht , dauns , and fuchs investigate such rings in @xcite .",
    "a module @xmath1 over a ring @xmath0 is _ torsion - free in the classical sense _ if @xmath13 for every nonzero @xmath3 and every regular @xmath6 , where @xmath6 is _ regular _ if it is not a left or right zero - divisor . for commutative rings ,",
    "this is a useful way to define such modules , especially for integral domains since regular elements are precisely the nonzero elements . in the case",
    "@xmath0 is non - commutative , then the set @xmath14",
    "@xmath15 @xmath16 contains some regular element of r@xmath17 , which is usually referred to as the _ torsion - submodule _ in the commutative setting , is not necessarily a submodule of @xmath1 .",
    "there are other ways in which torsion - freeness can be defined in the non - commutative setting . in @xcite",
    ", hattori calls a right @xmath0-module @xmath1 _ torsion - free _ if @xmath18 for every @xmath6 .",
    "this is based on homological properties of modules and coincides with the classical definition in the case @xmath0 is commutative . in @xcite , goodearl defines the singular submodule and non - singularity of modules in the general non - commutative setting , which is closely related to the concept of torsion submodules and torsion - freeness .",
    "we look at relevant background information on torsion - freeness and non - singularity in chapters 4 and 5 .",
    "albrecht , dauns , and fuchs found that @xmath7 is right strongly non - singular and the classes of torsion - free and non - singular @xmath7-modules coincide for every ring @xmath7 morita equivalent to a ring @xmath0 if and only if @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular , right semi - hereditary , and does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents ( * ? ? ? * theorem 5.1 ) .",
    "a ring is _ right strongly non - singular _ if its maximal right ring of quotients is a perfect left localization .",
    "these rings will be explored in section 5.2 , and semi - hereditary rings will be defined and explored in chapter 2 .",
    "we make use of this theorem and take it a step further to show that @xmath9 is a right and left utumi baer - ring if and only if the classes of torsion - free and non - singular @xmath7-modules coincide for every ring @xmath7 morita equivalent to a ring @xmath0 .",
    "note that we remove the condition that every morita - equivalent ring @xmath7 need be strongly non - singular .",
    "instead , we assume that our ring @xmath0 is right utumi , and from this we also get that @xmath9 is both right and left utumi .",
    "we define utumi rings in section 5.3 .",
    "unless noted otherwise , commutativity of a ring is not assumed , but all rings are assumed to have a multiplicative identity .",
    "we begin by looking at projective modules .",
    "a right r - module p is _ projective _ if given right r - modules a and b , an epimorphism @xmath19 , and a homomorphism @xmath20 b , then there exists a homomorphism @xmath21 : p @xmath22 a such that @xmath23 = @xmath24 .",
    "in particular , every free right @xmath0-module is projective ( * ? ? ? * theorem 3.1 ) .",
    "we make use of the following well - known characterization of projective modules :    @xcite[projective ] let @xmath0 be a ring .",

    "thus , without loss of generality , it can be assumed that @xmath25 is a free right r - module .",

    "two idempotents @xmath226 and @xmath155 are called _ orthogonal _ if @xmath227 and @xmath228 . if @xmath0 contains only finite sets of orthogonal idempotents , then being a p.p .- ring is right - left - symmetric .",

    "before discussing torsion - freeness and non - singularity of modules , we need some basic results in homological algebra regarding tensor products , flat modules , and functors .",
    "let @xmath268 be a right @xmath0-module , @xmath322 a left @xmath0-module , and @xmath350 any abelian group .",
    "a function @xmath351 is called _ @xmath0-biadditive _ , or _",
    "@xmath0-bilinear _ , if the following conditions are satisfied :    a.   for each @xmath352 and @xmath55 , @xmath353 , b.   for each @xmath62 and @xmath354 , @xmath355 , c.   for each @xmath62 , @xmath55 , and @xmath6 , @xmath356",
    ".    note that in general @xmath357 .",
    "the _ tensor product _ of @xmath268 and @xmath322 , denoted @xmath358 , is an abelian group and an @xmath0-biadditive function @xmath359 having the universal property that whenever @xmath350 is an abelian group and @xmath360 is @xmath0-biadditive , there is a unique map @xmath361 such that @xmath362 .",
    "@xcite[tensor exist ] let @xmath0 be a ring .",
    "given a right @xmath0-module @xmath268 and a left @xmath0-module @xmath322 , the tensor product @xmath358 exists .",
    "let @xmath133 be a free abelian group with basis @xmath363 , and let @xmath109 be a subgroup of @xmath133 generated by all elements of the form @xmath364 , @xmath365 , or @xmath366 , where @xmath352 , @xmath354 , and @xmath6 .",
    "define @xmath358 to be @xmath367 , and denote @xmath368 as @xmath369 .",
    "in addition , let @xmath359 be defined by @xmath370 .",

    "a ring @xmath0 is _ torsion - free _ if every finitely generated right ( or left ) ideal is torsion - free as a right ( or left ) @xmath0-module .",

    "* proposition 7)[submod of tor free ring ] a ring @xmath0 is torsion - free if and only if every submodule of a torsion - free right @xmath0-module is torsion - free .",
    "suppose @xmath0 is torsion - free and let @xmath27 be a submodule of a torsion - free right @xmath0-module @xmath1 .",
    "consider the exact sequence @xmath714 , where @xmath130 is the inclusion map and @xmath664 is the canonical epimorphism .",

    "if we consider the long exact sequence derived from the functor @xmath718 , then @xmath719 is exact .",
    "therefore , @xmath720 and @xmath27 is torsion - free . on the other hand , if every submodule of a torsion - free right @xmath0-module is torsion - free , then every finitely generated right ideal of @xmath0 is torsion - free since @xmath0 itself is torsion - free as a right @xmath0-module .",

    "therefore , @xmath0 does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",

    "thus , we consider a more general way to define the right ring of quotients which guarantees its existence for any ring @xmath0 .",

    "the following results about maximal quotient rings will be needed later .",
    "the proofs are omitted .",
    "( * ? ? ? * proposition 2.2)[adf 2.2 ] for a right non - singular ring @xmath0 , @xmath0 is a left p.p .- ring such that @xmath972 is torsion - free as a right r - module if and only if all non - singular right r - modules are torsion - free .",
    "xii , proposition 7.2)[ns fg embedding ] if @xmath0 is a right non - singular ring and @xmath1 is a finitely generated non - singular right r - module , then there exists a monomorphism + @xmath1049 for some @xmath1050 . in other words",
    ", @xmath1 is isomorphic to a submodule of a free @xmath971-module .    for a ring @xmath0 ,",
    "its maximal right ring of quotients @xmath1051 is a _ perfect left localization of @xmath0 _ if @xmath1051 is flat as a right @xmath0-module and the multiplication map @xmath1052 , defined by @xmath1053 , is an isomorphism . if @xmath0 is a right non - singular ring for which @xmath1051 is a perfect left localization , then @xmath0 is called _ right strongly non - singular_. goodearl provides the following useful characterization of right strongly non - singular rings :    ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 5.17)[qr perf rt local ] let r be a right non - singular ring . then",
    ", r is right strongly non - singular if and only if every finitely generated non - singular right r - module is isomorphic to a finitely generated submodule of a free right r - module .",
    "* theorem 5.18)[goodearl 5.18 ] let @xmath0 be a right non - singular ring .",
    "then , @xmath0 is right semi - hereditary , right strongly non - singular if and only if every finitely generated non - singular right @xmath0-module is projective .    for a right non - singular ring @xmath0 ,",
    "suppose @xmath0 is right semi - hereditary , right strongly non - singular .",
    "let @xmath1 be a finitely generated non - singular right @xmath0-module . by",
    ", @xmath1 is isomorphic to a finitely generated submodule of a free right @xmath0-module @xmath133 .",
    "therefore , since @xmath0 is right semi - hereditary , @xmath1 is projective by .",
    "conversely , assume every finitely generated non - singular right @xmath0-module is projective .",
    "since @xmath0 is right non - singular , every finitely generated right ideal of @xmath0 is non - singular .",
    "hence , every finitely generated right ideal is projective and @xmath0 is right semi - hereditary .",
    "furthermore , every finitely generated non - singular right @xmath0-module is a direct summand , and hence a submodule , of a free right @xmath0-module .",
    "therefore , @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular by .",
    "we know turn our attention to rings for which the classes of torsion - free and non - singular right @xmath0-modules coincide , which is investigated in @xcite by albrecht , dauns , and fuchs .",
    "a few definitions are needed before stating their theorems in full .",
    "a ring is _ right semi - simple _ if it can be written as a direct sum of modules which have no proper nonzero submodules , and a ring is _ right artinian _ if it satisfies the descending chain condition on right ideals .",
    "assume _ semi - simple artinain _ to mean _ right semi - simple , right artinian_. the following results from stenstrm consider rings with semi - simple right maximal ring of quotients .",
    "( * ? ? ? *",
    "ch . xi , proposition 5.4)[qr = ql iff flat ] let r be a ring whose maximal right ring of quotients is semi - simple . then , @xmath1054 if and only if @xmath971 is flat as a right r - module .",
    "xii , corollaries 2.6,2.8)[q ss then left sns ] let @xmath0 be a ring and suppose @xmath972 is semi - simple . then :    a.   @xmath971 is a perfect right localization of r. in other words , if @xmath0 is left non - singular , then it is left strongly non - singular .",
    "b.   if @xmath1 is any non - singular right @xmath0-module , then @xmath1055 is the injective hull of @xmath1 .",
    "a ring @xmath0 is _ von neumann regular _ if , given any @xmath6 , there exists some @xmath452 such that @xmath1056 .",
    "these rings are of interest because @xmath0 is von neumann regular if and only if every right @xmath0-module is flat ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 4.9 ) .",
    "the following lemmas will be needed in the next chapter .",
    "@xcite[semi reg ] if r is a semi - simple artinian ring , then r is von neumann regular .",
    "the wedderburn - artin theorem states that @xmath0 is semi - simple artinian if and only if it is isomorphic to a finite direct product of matrix rings over division rings . for any division ring @xmath1057",
    ", @xmath1058 is von neumann regular @xcite .",
    "therefore , @xmath0 is von neumann regular since direct products of regular rings are regular .",
    "@xcite[nonsing reg ] a ring r is right non - singular if and only if @xmath971 is von neumann regular .",
    "stenstrm shows in ( * ? ? ?",
    "xii ) that if @xmath0 is right non - singular , then @xmath1059 , where @xmath1060 is the injective hull of @xmath0 . in (",
    "v , proposition 6.1 ) , it is shown that such rings are regular .    conversely , assume @xmath971 is von neumann regular .",

    "if @xmath0 is a right non - singular ring and every @xmath1070-closed right ideal of @xmath0 is a right annihilator , then @xmath0 is referred to as a _",
    "right utumi ring_. similarly , @xmath0 is a _",
    "left utumi ring _",
    "if @xmath0 is left non - singular and every @xmath1070-closed left ideal of @xmath0 is a left annihilator .",
    "the following result from goodearl characterizes non - singular rings which are both right and left utumi .",
    "* theorem 2.38)[ql = qr ] if r is a right and left non - singular ring , then @xmath1054 if and only if every @xmath0 is both right and left utumi .    for a ring @xmath0 ,",
    "if every direct sum of nonzero right ideals of @xmath0 contains only finitely many direct summands , then @xmath0 is said to have _ finite right goldie - dimension_. denote the goldie - dimension of @xmath0 as @xmath350-dim @xmath975 .",
    "if a ring @xmath0 with finite right goldie - dimension also satisfies the ascending chain condition on right annihilators , then @xmath0 is a _",
    "right goldie - ring_. the maximal right quotient ring @xmath971 is a _ semi - perfect left localization of @xmath0 _ if @xmath1086 is torsion - free and the multiplication map @xmath1087 is an isomorphism .",
    "the following is a useful characterization of rings with finite right goldie dimension :    ( * ? ? ?",
    "xii , theorem 2.5)[q semi goldie dim ] if @xmath0 is a right non - singular ring , then @xmath971 is semi - simple if and only if r has finite right goldie dimension .",
    "we are now ready to state two key results form albrecht , fuchs , and dauns , which consider rings for which the classes of torsion - free and non - singular modules coincide .",
    "these will be needed in the next chapter to prove the main theorem of this thesis .",
    "the proof of is omitted .",
    "* theorem 3.7)[tf and ns 3.7 ] the following are equivalent for a ring r :    a.   r is a right goldie right p.p .- ring and @xmath971 is a semi - perfect left localization of r. b.   r is a right utumi p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents . c.   r is a right non - singular ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents , and every finitely generated non - singular right r - module is torsion - free .",
    "d.   a right r - module m is torsion - free if and only if m is non - singular .",
    "furthermore , if r satisfies any of the equivalent conditions , then r is a baer - ring and @xmath971 is semi - simple artinian .",
    "@xcite[adf 4.2 ] the following are equivalent for a ring r :    a.   r is a right and left non - singular ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents , and every @xmath1070-closed left or right ideal is generated by an idempotent .",
    "b.   r is a right or left p.p .- ring , and @xmath1054 is semi - simple artinian . c.   r is a right strongly non - singular right p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "d.   r is right strongly non - singular , and a right r - module is torsion - free if and only if it is non - singular .",
    "e.   for a right r - module m , the following are equivalent : a.   m is torsion - free b.   m is non - singular c.   if @xmath1088 is the injective hull of @xmath1 , then @xmath1088 is flat .",
    "( @xmath75 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath77 ) : assume @xmath0 is right and left non - singular , contains no infinite set of orthogonal idempotents , and every @xmath1070-closed right or left ideal is generated by an idempotent .",
    "let @xmath4 be an @xmath1070-closed right ideal of @xmath0 .",
    "then , @xmath1089 for some idempotent @xmath97 . as shown in the proof of , @xmath776 .",
    "thus , @xmath1089 is the right annihilator of @xmath1090 .",
    "note that a symmetric argument shows that if @xmath680 is an @xmath1070-closed left ideal of @xmath0 , then @xmath1091 is a left annihilator of @xmath795 for some idempotent @xmath293 .",
    "hence , @xmath0 is both a right and left utumi ring .",
    "by , since @xmath0 is a right non - singular ring , @xmath16 is @xmath1070-closed for every @xmath99 .",
    "this implies that @xmath16 is generated by an idempotent for every @xmath99 .",
    "therefore , @xmath0 is a right p.p - ring .",
    "a symmetric argument shows that @xmath0 is also a left p.p .- ring since condition ( @xmath75 ) applies to both right and left ideals .",
    "note that @xmath0 satisfies condition ( @xmath77 ) of since it is a right utumi p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "hence , @xmath971 is semi - simple artinian by .",
    "furthermore , since every right and left @xmath1070-closed ideal is an annihilator , @xmath0 is right and left utumi . therefore , @xmath1054 by .",
    "( @xmath77 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath1092 ) : suppose @xmath0 is a right p.p .- ring and @xmath1054 is semi - simple artinian . since @xmath0 is a right p.p .- ring , it is also a right non - singular ring .",
    "hence , @xmath0 has finite right goldie dimension by .",
    "suppose @xmath0 contains an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "consider two orthogonal idempotents @xmath226 and @xmath155 , and let @xmath1093 @xmath1094 @xmath208 .",
    "then , @xmath1095 for some @xmath1096 , @xmath1097 .",

    "thus , @xmath1099 @xmath1094 @xmath1100 for any two orthogonal idempotents @xmath226 and @xmath155 in the infinite set , and @xmath1101 is direct .",
    "hence , @xmath0 contains an infinite direct sum of nonzero right submodules , which contradicts @xmath0 having finite right goldie dimension .",
    "therefore , @xmath0 does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .    by",
    ", since @xmath0 is semi - simple artinian , @xmath0 is a left strongly non - singular ring .",
    "hence , the multiplication map @xmath1102 , defined by @xmath1103 , is an isomorphism .",
    "note that this also implies that @xmath971 is flat as a left r - module .",
    "however , in order for @xmath0 to be right strongly non - singular , it needs to be shown that @xmath971 is flat as a right r - module . by",
    ", @xmath971 is indeed flat as a right r - module since @xmath1054 is assumed to be semi - simple artinian .",
    "therefore , @xmath0 is a right strongly non - singular ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "note that shows that @xmath0 is also a left p.p .- ring .",
    "thus , if we had instead assumed that @xmath0 is a left p.p .- ring , then a symmetric argument could be used to show that @xmath0 is also a right p.p .- ring , and the latter part of the proof would remain the same .",
    "( @xmath1092 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath1104 ) : assume @xmath0 is a right strongly non - singular right p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "then , @xmath971 is flat as a right r - module , which follows from @xmath0 being right strongly non - singular .",
    "since flat r - modules are torsion - free , this implies that @xmath971 is torsion - free . by ,",
    "since @xmath0 is a right p.p .- ring and does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents , @xmath0 is also a left p.p .- ring .",
    "hence , every non - singular right r - module is torsion - free by .",
    "thus , @xmath0 satisfies condition ( @xmath1092 ) of , which implies that a right r - module m is torsion - free if and only if m is non - singular .",
    "( @xmath1104 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath226 ) : suppose @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular , and a right r - module is torsion - free if and only if it is non - singular .",
    "then , conditions ( @xmath142 ) and ( @xmath1105 ) of ( @xmath226 ) are clearly equivalent , and it suffices to show that a right r - module is non - singular if and only if its injective hull is flat .",
    "suppose @xmath1 is a non - singular right r - module .",
    "note that @xmath0 satisfies condition ( @xmath1104 ) of , and hence @xmath971 is semi - simple artinian . by , @xmath1055 is an injective hull of @xmath1 .",
    "thus , if @xmath1088 denotes the injective hull of @xmath1 , then @xmath1106 , since an injective hull of a right r - module is unique up to isomorphism .",
    "this implies that @xmath1088 is a right @xmath971-module , since @xmath1055 is a right @xmath971-module by .",
    "furthermore , since @xmath971 is semi - simple artinian , every @xmath971-module is projective .",
    "hence , @xmath1088 is projective and thus isomorphic to a direct summand of a free @xmath971-module @xmath133 .",
    "note that @xmath971 is flat as a right r - module since @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular .",
    "thus , shows that any free @xmath971-module is flat since such modules can be written as @xmath1107 for some index set @xmath4 , where @xmath502 is isomorphic to @xmath971 for every @xmath503 .",
    "this implies that @xmath1088 is flat by since it is a direct summand of the flat right @xmath0-module @xmath1108 .    on the other hand ,",
    "assume that the injective hull @xmath1088 of some right r - module @xmath1 is flat .",
    "noting again that @xmath0 satisfies condition ( @xmath1104 ) of , it follows that @xmath0 is a right p.p .- ring .",
    "thus , @xmath0 is a torsion - free ring by .",
    "since flat @xmath0-modules are torsion - free , @xmath1088 is torsion - free as a right r - module .",
    "hence , @xmath1 is a submodule of a torsion - free right r - module .",
    "thus , @xmath1 is a torsion free right r - module by .",
    "therefore , @xmath1 is non - singular since a right @xmath0-module is torsion - free if and only if it is non - singular by assumption .",
    "( @xmath226 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath75 ) : for a right @xmath0-module @xmath1 , assume that @xmath1 is torsion - free if and only if @xmath1 is non - singular if and only if the injective hull @xmath1088 is flat . by , @xmath0 is a right p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "it then follows from that @xmath0 is a right non - singular ring .",
    "hence , @xmath0 is also a left p.p .- ring by , since every non - singular right r - module is torsion - free , and a symmetric argument for shows that @xmath0 is left non - singular .",
    "the injective hull @xmath1109 is flat as a right r - module since @xmath0 is assumed to be right non - singular .",
    "hence , @xmath971 is flat as a right r - module , since @xmath971 is the injective hull of @xmath0 .",
    "we ve already shown that @xmath0 satisfies the equivalent conditions of , which implies that @xmath971 is a semi - simple artinian ring .",
    "thus , it follows from that @xmath1054 .",
    "since @xmath0 is both right and left non - singular , every @xmath1070-closed right ideal of @xmath0 is a right annihilator and every @xmath1070-closed left ideal of @xmath0 is a left annihilator by .",
    "furthermore , note that shows that @xmath0 is a baer - ring .",
    "hence , every annihilator is generated by an idempotent .",
    "therefore , every @xmath1070-closed right ideal and every @xmath1070-closed left ideal is generated by an idempotent .",
    "before proving the main theorem , we discuss morita equivalences .",
    "in particular , we show that there is a morita equivalence between @xmath0 and @xmath9 for any @xmath108 .",
    "this is then used to show that the classes of torsion - free and non - singular @xmath9-modules coincide for certain conditions placed on @xmath0 .",
    "let r and s be rings .",
    "the categories @xmath31 and @xmath603 are _ equivalent _ ( or _ isomorphic _ ) if there are functors @xmath1110 and @xmath1111 such that @xmath1112 and @xmath1113 .",
    "note that these are natural isomorphisms .",
    "in other words , if @xmath1114 denotes the natural isomorphism , then for each @xmath1115 , there exist isomorphisms @xmath1116 and @xmath1117 such that @xmath1118 whenever @xmath1119 .",
    "here , @xmath1120 denotes the induced homomorphism .",
    "the functors @xmath133 and @xmath350 are referred to as an _ equivalence _ of @xmath31 and @xmath603 .",
    "if such an equivalence exists , then r and s are said to be _ morita - equivalent_. in ( * ? ? ?",
    "iv , corollary 10.2 ) , stenstrm shows that r and s are morita - equivalent if and only if there are bimodules @xmath1121 and @xmath1122 such that @xmath1123 and @xmath1124 .",
    "a property @xmath25 is referred to as _ morita - invariant _ if for every ring @xmath0 satisfying @xmath25 , every ring @xmath7 morita - equivalent to @xmath0 also satisfies @xmath25 .",
    "a _ generator _ of @xmath31 is a right @xmath0-module @xmath25 satisfying the condition that every right @xmath0-module @xmath1 is a quotient of @xmath1125 .",
    "note that @xmath0 and any free right @xmath0-module are generators of @xmath31 .",
    "a _ progenerator _ of @xmath31 is a generator which is finitely generated and projective .",
    "@xcite[equivalence ] let @xmath0 be a ring , @xmath25 a progenerator of @xmath31 , and @xmath1126 .",
    "then , there is an equivalence @xmath1110 given by @xmath1127 with inverse @xmath1111 given by @xmath1128 .    as a projective generator of @xmath31 ,",
    "@xmath25 is a right @xmath0-module .",

    "it then readily follows that @xmath25 is an @xmath619-bimodule since @xmath553 for any @xmath136 and @xmath6 .",
    "thus , @xmath1131 is a functor @xmath594 and @xmath1132 is a functor @xmath592 by .",
    "it needs to be shown that @xmath1113 and @xmath1112 are natural isomorphisms .",

    "a.   @xmath0 is a right strongly non - singular , right semi - hereditary , right utumi ring not containing an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",

    "( @xmath75 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath77 ) : assume r is a right strongly non - singular , right semi - hereditary , right utumi ring not containing an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "let @xmath0 and @xmath7 be morita equivalent , and let @xmath1110 and @xmath1111 be an equivalence .",
    "also , take @xmath27 to be a finitely generated non - singular right r - module . since @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular",
    ", @xmath27 is isomorphic to finitely generated submodule @xmath118 of a free right r - module by .",
    "furthermore , since @xmath0 is right semi - hereditary and free r - modules are projective , @xmath1163 is projective by .",
    "thus , since projective modules are torsion - free , it follows that finitely generated non - singular right r - modules are torsion - free .",
    "therefore , r satisfies condition ( @xmath1092 ) of , which implies that the maximal ring of quotients @xmath972 is a semi - simple artinian ring .",
    "note that @xmath972 and @xmath1136 are morita - equivalent by .",
    "hence , @xmath1136 is also semi - simple artinian , since semi - simpleness and artinian are properties preserved under a morita - equivalence @xcite .",
    "furthermore , @xmath1136 is a regular ring by .",
    "therefore , shows that @xmath7 is right non - singular .",
    "let @xmath1 be a finitely generated non - singular right s - module .",
    "then , @xmath1164 is a finitely generated non - singular right r - module since non - singularity and being finitely generated are both morita - invariant properties @xcite .",
    "thus , since @xmath0 is a right strongly non - singular ring , @xmath1164 is isomorphic to a finitely generated submodule of a free right r - module @xmath25 by .",
    "note that as a free right r - module , @xmath25 is projective , which is also a morita - invariant property @xcite .",
    "hence , @xmath1165 is a projective right s - module .",
    "furthermore , since @xmath1164 is isomorphic to a finitely generated submodule of @xmath25 , @xmath1166 is isomorphic to a finitely generated submodule @xmath109 of @xmath1165 .",
    "now , @xmath1165 is projective and hence a submodule of a free right s - module , which implies @xmath1167 is a submodule of a free right @xmath7-module .",
    "therefore , @xmath1 is isomorphic to a finitely generated submodule of a free right s - module , and @xmath7 is right strongly non - singular by .",
    "it has been shown that @xmath7 is a right non - singular ring with a semi - simple artinian maximal right ring of quotients .",
    "thus , @xmath7 has finite right goldie dimension by .",
    "hence , @xmath7 can not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "moreover , @xmath7 is a right p.p .- ring since @xmath0 is right semi - hereditary . for",
    "if @xmath25 is a principal right ideal of @xmath7 , then @xmath1168 is a finitely generated right ideal of the right semi - hereditary ring @xmath0 , which implies that @xmath1168 is projective .",
    "hence , @xmath1169 is projective , which again follows from projectivity being morita - invariant .",
    "then , @xmath7 is a right strongly non - singular right p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "therefore , a right s - module is torsion - free if and only if it is non - singular by .",
    "( @xmath77 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath75 ) : assume that the classes of torsion - free and non - singular @xmath7-modules coincide for every ring @xmath7 morita - equivalent to @xmath0 .",
    "thus , since @xmath9 is morita - equivalent to @xmath0 for every @xmath112 , the classes of torsion - free right @xmath9-modules and non - singular right @xmath9-modules coincide for every @xmath112 .",
    "hence , @xmath9 is a right utumi p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents by .",
    "thus , @xmath0 is right semi - hereditary by . in particular , since these conditions are satisfied for every @xmath112 , they are satisfied for @xmath113 . hence , @xmath1170 is a right semi - hereditary right utumi ring not containing an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "it needs to be shown that @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular .",
    "let @xmath1 be a finitely generated non - singular right @xmath0-module . by , @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular if @xmath1 is projective .",
    "let @xmath1171 be an exact sequence of right @xmath0-modules . since @xmath133 is a finitely generated free right @xmath0-module , it is a progenerator of @xmath31 .",
    "hence , @xmath1172 is exact by .",
    "moreover , if @xmath1173 , then @xmath1110 given by @xmath1174 and @xmath1111 given by @xmath1175 is an equivalence by .",
    "thus , @xmath1176 is a non - singular right @xmath7-module by ( @xmath1105 ) .",
    "furthermore , since @xmath7 is morita - equivalent to @xmath0 , the @xmath7-module @xmath1176 is torsion - free by assumption . note that since the sequence is exact , @xmath1177 .",
    "thus , @xmath1176 is cyclic as an @xmath7-module since @xmath1178 is a right ideal of the right @xmath7-module @xmath7 . note",
    "also that @xmath7 is a left p.p .- ring by since @xmath7 is a right p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "thus , the cyclic torsion - free right @xmath7-module @xmath1176 is projective by .",
    "therefore , @xmath1179 is a projective right @xmath0-module and @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular .",
    "( @xmath75 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath1092 ) : assume @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular , right semi - hereditary , right utumi , and does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "it has been shown that any ring @xmath7 morita - equivalent to such a ring is right strongly non - singular and the classes of torsion - free and non - singular right @xmath7-modules coincide .",
    "thus , @xmath9 is right strongly non - singular and a right @xmath9-module is torsion - free if and only if it is non - singular , which follows from @xmath9 being morita - equivalent to @xmath0 for any @xmath108 . by",
    ", @xmath9 is a right strongly non - singular right p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "it then follows from that @xmath9 satisfies the ascending chain condition on right annihilators .",
    "furthermore , shows that since @xmath9 is a right p.p .- ring , @xmath9 is a torsion - free ring such that right annihilators of elements are finitely generated .",
    "hence , @xmath9 is a baer - ring by .",
    "moreover , shows that every @xmath1070-closed one - sided ideal of @xmath9 is generated by an idempotent .",
    "thus , every right ideal of @xmath9 is a right annihilator and every left ideal of @xmath9 is a left annihilator .",
    "hence , @xmath9 is a right and left utumi ring .",
    "( @xmath1092 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath75 ) : suppose @xmath9 is a right and left utumi baer - ring for every @xmath112 and does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "then , @xmath9 is a right p.p .- ring , and so @xmath0 is right semi - hereditary by .",
    "furthermore , since @xmath9 satisfies these conditions for every @xmath112 , @xmath1170 is a right and left utumi baer - ring not containing an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents .",
    "thus , every @xmath1070-closed one - sided ideal of @xmath0 is an annihilator and hence generated by an idempotent . therefore , since @xmath0 is a right and left p.p .- ring and hence right and left non - singular , @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular by .",
    "( @xmath75 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath77 ) : suppose @xmath0 is right and left utumi and right semi - hereditary .",
    "then , @xmath0 is a right p.p .- ring and hence right non - singular .",
    "moreover , @xmath0 is a left p.p .- ring by , which implies that @xmath0 is also a left non - singular ring . since @xmath0 is both right and left utumi , @xmath1180 by .",
    "furthermore , since @xmath0 is a right utumi right p.p .- ring which does not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents , @xmath1180 is semi - simple artinian and torsion - free by .",
    "therefore , @xmath0 is right strongly non - singular by .",
    "since @xmath0 is a right strongly non - singular , right semi - hereditary , right utumi ring not containing an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents , the classes of torsion - free and non - singular right @xmath9-modules coincide by .",
    "moreover , the proof of shows that @xmath9 is right strongly non - singular .",
    "thus , @xmath9 is a right strongly non - singular , right p.p .- ring not contain an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents by .",
    "it then follows from that @xmath9 satisfies the ascending chain condition on right annihilators .",
    "since @xmath9 is a right p.p .- ring , shows that @xmath9 is a torsion - free ring such that right annihilators of elements are finitely generated .",
    "hence , @xmath9 is a baer - ring by .",
    "( @xmath77 ) @xmath76 ( @xmath75 ) : assume @xmath9 is a baer - ring for every @xmath108 , and @xmath972 is torsion - free as a right @xmath0-module . since @xmath9 is a baer - ring , it is both a right and left p.p .- ring .",
    "hence , @xmath0 is both right and left semi - hereditary by .",
    "it then readily follows that @xmath0 is right and left non - singular .",
    "note also that @xmath1170 is a baer - ring since @xmath9 is baer for every @xmath108 .",
    "let @xmath4 be a proper @xmath1070-closed right ideal of @xmath0 .",
    "then , @xmath1181 is non - singular as a right r - module .",
    "furthermore , @xmath1181 is cyclic and thus finitely generated .",
    "hence , @xmath1181 is isomorphic to a submodule of a free @xmath971-module by .",
    "since @xmath971 is assumed to be torsion - free as a right r - module , it follows from that @xmath4 is generated by an idempotent @xmath97 .",
    "hence , @xmath1182 by and @xmath0 is right utumi .",
    "observe that the argument works for @xmath1070-closed left ideals as well , and so @xmath0 is also left utumi .",
    "we conclude by considering two examples , the first of which illustrates why the condition of being right semi - hereditary is necessary in the main theorem .",
    "let @xmath1183 $ ] .",
    "as an integral domain , @xmath0 is a strongly non - singular p.p .- ring not containing an infinite set of orthogonal idempotents ( * ? ? ?",
    "* corollary 3.10 ) . by ,",
    "the classes of torsion - free and non - singular right @xmath0-modules coincide , and by @xmath0 is right utumi .",
    "however , @xmath0 is not semi - hereditary since the ideal @xmath1184 + 2\\mathbb{z}[x]$ ] of @xmath1185 $ ] is not projective .",
    "as seen in the proof of , this implies @xmath1186 is not a right or left p.p .- ring , and hence not a baer ring .",
    "therefore , the main theorem does not hold if @xmath0 is not assumed to be right semi - hereditary .",
    "moreover , this example shows that the classes of torsion - free and non - singular @xmath7-modules do not necessarily coincide , even if this holds for @xmath0 and there is a morita - equivalence between @xmath0 and @xmath7 .",
    "finally , we consider an example from @xcite which details a ring with finite right goldie - dimension but infinite left goldie - dimension . in the context of this thesis , this example provides a right utumi baer - ring which is not left utumi .",
    "let @xmath1187 for some field @xmath133 and consider the endomorphism @xmath155 of @xmath132 determined by @xmath1188 .",
    "the ring we consider is @xmath1189 $ ] with coefficients written on the right and multiplication defined according to @xmath1190 for @xmath1191 .",
    "observe that @xmath1192 .",
    "it can be shown that @xmath1193 , and hence @xmath1194 is an infinite direct sum of left ideals of @xmath0 .",
    "thus , @xmath0 has infinite left goldie - dimension . on the other hand , every right ideal of @xmath0 is a principal ideal @xcite , and thus @xmath0 is right noetherian .",
    "hence , @xmath0 is a right goldie - ring .",
    "it then follows from that @xmath0 is a right utumi baer ring and @xmath971 is semi - simple artinian .",
    "however , @xmath0 having infinite left goldie - dimension but finite right goldie - dimension implies that @xmath974 ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 4.1 ) .",
    "therefore , shows that @xmath0 can not be left utumi ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we consider some existing results regarding rings for which the classes of torsion - free and non - singular right modules coincide . here </S>",
    "<S> , a right @xmath0-module @xmath1 is _ non - singular _ if @xmath2 is nonzero for every nonzero @xmath3 and every essential right ideal @xmath4 of @xmath0 , and a right @xmath0-module @xmath1 is _ torsion - free _ if @xmath5 for every @xmath6 . in particular </S>",
    "<S> , we consider a ring @xmath0 for which the classes of torsion - free and non - singular right @xmath7-modules coincide for every ring @xmath7 morita - equivalent to @xmath0 . </S>",
    "<S> we make use of these results , as well as the existence of a morita - equivalence between a ring @xmath0 and the @xmath8 matrix ring @xmath9 , to characterize rings whose @xmath8 matrix ring is a baer - ring . </S>",
    "<S> a ring is _ baer _ if every right ( or left ) annihilator is generated by an idempotent . </S>",
    "<S> semi - hereditary , strongly non - singular , and utumi rings will play an important role , and we explore these concepts and relevant results as well . </S>"
  ]
}
